page.title: 01Landscape Moorland Soils
page.content: High millstone grit moorlands with thick deposits of peat make up the western area of this block. The land here rises to over 500m and the highest point on the S.W. corner is over 570m and close to the summit of Black Hill just outside the area. The land here is unenclosed and is covered by Sheeps Fescule, Cotton grass and other moorland vegetation. Some sheep are moved on to this higher land in the summer and commercial shooting interests also operate here. Many small streams drain off the plateau-like upland and flow into the reservoir complex in the lower eastern half off the area. The land surface falls steeply, with small fields seperated by dry stone walls to the lowest land at 180m above sea level.
